title: Why a tonne of industrial carbon costs $95 in Alberta but credits sell for less than $20
description: A key part of the pipeline deal between Alberta and Ottawa is a “minimum effective credit price of $130 per tonne” on industrial carbon emissions, but already the two levels of government are talking about that figure in different ways. The rhetoric is confus…
content: A key part of the memorandum of understanding between Alberta and Ottawa for a new pipeline is a $130-per-tonne "effective credit price" on industrial carbon emissions, but already the two levels of … [+11195 chars]
